column4: anyone here know how to add a line to the grub boot to make vista selectable after installing ubuntu in a different harddrive, it whiped out the old boot info obviously but i need to be able to use vista or ubuntu, (vista installed first) then (ubuntu installed on a different harddrive)
please pastebin your /boot/grub/menu.lst and sudo fdisk -l
and sudo fdisk -l?
http://pastebin.com/d7d8f87e0
I presume sda5 is your windows install?
i believe so its the only other internal hdd
okay modify your menu.lst to look like http://pastebin.com/f1f5ab42
should i copy and paste that one or change it to look like yours?
you just need to add the last few lines
lets see if it'll work first :)
ill try it now thanks
it gave me a error
what was the error?
i have ubuntu installed on primare IDE drive and vista installed on secondary sata drive but vista installed first could that be a problem?
hmm, no as I followed the fdisk output. What was the error?
as i am not intelligent enough to copy it down.... lmao
if you could that would be really helpful
in channel please, and your fdisk output said it was the second partition on the first drive
wait, so which hard drive is ubuntu installed on?
ubuntu is installed on the primary ide drive
okay, and vista?
vista is installed on the secondary SATA drive there is only one partition on each drive
okay, then yes in that case try hd(1,0)
